definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

pinyin: da4 gui1 mo2 sha1 shang1 xing4 wu3 qi4

sentences.english: Can you apply that outside of high-traffic Web sites?
sentences.chinese: 能否把这样的方法应用到大规模流量网站之外的应用？

sentences.english: But who loses their jobs at the mass layoffs?
sentences.chinese: 但在大规模失业期，没工作的是谁呢？

sentences.english: This was the result from the large-scale regression in the Late Ordovician.
sentences.chinese: 这是晚奥陶世晚期大规模海退的结果。

sentences.english: Moving the metal is like 'a big military operation, ' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说，运送黄金就像一场大规模的军事行动。

sentences.english: A massive international research effort led to the identification of the virus responsible.
sentences.chinese: 大规模的国际研究工作形成了有效的病毒鉴别方法。

sentences.english: But economic reform and mass urbanization in the last 30 years have upended these norms.
sentences.chinese: 但过去30年的经济改革和大规模城市化颠覆了这些。

sentences.english: Larger 10)amphibious assault forces attack beaches head on in massed formations.
sentences.chinese: 大型的两栖作战部队以大规模编队正面进攻海滩。

sentences.english: I'm not too sure there are many other teams who could possibly have coped with such a debilitating injury list.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定还有哪支球队能应对如此大规模的伤病。

sentences.english: The booms and busts have caused great redistributions of wealth.
sentences.chinese: 这样的繁荣和萧条带来了大规模的财富再分配。

sentences.english: The British army so large-scalely invades and depart his mainland again at present.
sentences.chinese: 英军这么大规模的入侵，离他的本土又这么远。

sentences.english: The salinity in seawater will increase when the sea ice are exploited and desalinated extensively.
sentences.chinese: 海冰的大规模开采和淡化会导致周围水体的盐分增加。

sentences.english: A library constructed with high walls of light diffused through large translucent glass.
sentences.chinese: 阿库通过大规模建造的半透明玻璃漫射光高墙。
巨灾即大规模的自然灾害。

sentences.english: Alternating direction methods are suitable ones for solving large-scale problems.
sentences.chinese: 交替方向法适合于求解大规模问题。

sentences.english: Since the beginning of the new century, the beginning of the large-scale introduction of this subject.
sentences.chinese: 从新世纪开始，这一学科开始被大规模的引进来。

sentences.english: Large anti-Japanese protests erupted during the latest party meeting.
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抗日游行在此次五中全会期间爆发。

definition: expansion/dilation/to expand (e.g. one's power or influence)/to broaden
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
to utilize/to put sth to use
